Key Arguments: The ACMA's current setup restricts freedom of expression, particularly for health and medical professionals.
The Covid vaccines were experimental and mandates were enforced without sufficient testing, likened to totalitarian rule.
ATAGI's decisions have suppressed dissenting medical opinions and deregistered professionals who disagreed.
Social media and independent websites have become the only platforms for dissenting voices, which are often labeled as conspiracy theories.
Government bodies, including ATAGI, may themselves be biased and spread misinformation.
A Royal Commission should investigate ATAGI's decisions before any new misinformation laws are enacted.
Notable Quotes: The ACMA’s current setup has contributed to the implementation of media restrictions that have been preventing freedom of expression by professional health and medical people.
Social media has become the only way those who follow the concepts of the Hippocratic Oath ‘to do no harm’ have been able to voice their concerns.
Government bodies can be dangerous when they take on too much power.
